meanings.sent1: She looked inward to find the answer within herself.
meanings.sent2: The door swung inward as we entered the room.
meanings.sent3: He tried to look inward but ended up staring at his own nose.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts turned inward like a whirlpool pulling her in.
meanings.sent5: The darkness of the cave drew him inward, deeper into its depths.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to the mind or spirit
meanings.sent1: His inward thoughts were a mystery to those around him.
meanings.sent2: She had an inward feeling of peace and contentment.
meanings.sent3: The cat's inward contemplation of the fishbowl was interrupted by a loud noise.
meanings.sent4: His inward struggles were like a storm raging within him.
meanings.sent5: The inward journey of self-discovery led to profound revelations.

meanings.definition: Directed or moving toward the inside
meanings.sent1: The inward motion of the train signaled our arrival at the station.
meanings.sent2: She felt an inward pull towards the mysterious door.
meanings.sent3: The inward flow of the river seemed to defy gravity.
meanings.sent4: His inward gaze seemed to penetrate through walls.
meanings.sent5: The inward spiral of the tornado was a terrifying sight.
